title.narrative: 1.2. INTEGRATED POLICIES FOR Early Child Development (ECD)

description.narrative: By 2016, Federal, State and Municipal government and social actors of 50% of the municipalities of the States in the Semiarid and Amazon Regions, and large urban centres enrolled in the Urban Centre Platform, are using methodologies and tools to promote early childhood policies and are implementing an Integrated Policy for Early Child Development (ECD) prioritising actions aimed at accelerating the reduction of maternal and neonatal mortality and early pregnancy., which contributes to Child Health, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Maternal And Newborn Health, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Sanitation, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016 infant mortality, maternal mortality, chronic malnutrition and early pregnancy are reduced in Brazil, especially in the Amazon and Semiarid regions and among indigenous and afro-Brazilians and a comprehensive National Policy for Early Childhood created and implemented with good practices and lessons learned systematized and disseminated in Brazil and in other countries.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, Federal, State and Municipal government and social actors of 50% of the municipalities of the States in the Semiarid andAmazon Regions, and large urban centres enrolled in the Urban Centre Platform, are using methodologies and tools to promote earlychildhood policies and are implementing an Integrated Policy for ECD prioritising actions aimed at accelerating the reduction ofmaternal and neonatal mortality and early pregnancy.

description.narrative: Despite the Zika virus epidemic emergency, UNICEF continued working with municipalities located in vulnerable areas through the UNICEF Seal Municipal Seal of Approval and in eight large urban centers, in order to fulfill the rights of women, families and children up to 6 years old. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:04/01/2017

title.narrative: % of municipalities enrolled in the UNICEF Seal and of large urban centers enrolled in the Urban Center Platform which have ECD Municipal Plans

target.value: 2016:40% of Seal municipalities, 50% of PCU municipalities

title.narrative: Existence of tools and methodologies to reduce early pregnancy (under 15)

baseline.value: PAM: 32 (10% of municipalities enrolled) , SAB: 127 (12% of municipalities enrolled), Urban Centers: 2 (100% of municipalities enrolled in Urban Centers Platform)

baseline.value: there is no systematic information available in the current edition of UNICEF Seal

title.narrative: Policy for home visits of new borns is developed and/or revised, adopted and in use
